contents.note: FictionMags Index (fiction listings from selected issues)

renewed-contributions.title: The Shocking Case of Gregory K. Elwood
Ben Eielson, Daring Pioneer of Alaskan Skies
The Most Dangerous Sport in the World
Tears in Your Cup
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE renewal record.  FictionMags gives title as 'Tears in Her Cup'.  We have not examined the issue in question.

author.authorized: Wylie, I. A. R. (Ida Alexa Ross), 1885-1959

renewed-contributions.title: Getting Paid for Having a Good Time
Mother of the North
renewed-contributions.note: CCE renewal record gives issue date as August 30, 1930, and the registration record number of this issue.  FictionMags does not mention it in its issue table of contents for August 1930, though it might only be noting fiction contributions.

renewed-contributions.title: Man Can Climb High
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE renewal record.  FictionMags gives title as 'A Man Can Climb High on His Last Legs'.

renewed-contributions.title: Dot Finds a Man for Polly
A Guttersnipe Grow Wings
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE renewal record. FictionMags gives title as 'A Guttersnipe Grows Wings'.

renewed-contributions.title: Captain Hawks
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE renewal record.  FictionMags gives the title of the James Hopper story appearing in this issue as 'The World's Greatest Salesman of Speed'.

renewed-contributions.title: Adventures in Solitude
renewed-contributions.note: Author is Ray Stannard Baker writing under a pseudonym.

renewed-contributions.title: Adventures in Solitude
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE renewal record. FictionMags gives title as 'What No Man Can Take from Me: Adventures in Solitude'. Author is Ray Stannard Baker writing under a pseudonym.

renewed-contributions.title: Admiral Moffett
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE renewal record.  FictionMags gives the title of the James Hopper article appearing in this issue as 'Moffett - Master Showman of the Air'.

author.authorized: Wylie, I. A. R. (Ida Alexa Ross), 1885-1959

renewed-contributions.title: Home-Town Folks, This is My America
My America, Belittle It If You Dare!
I Can't Marry a Poor Man
Shall We Get Rid of the Family?
The Strangled Witness
renewed-contributions.note: Author is Zenith Brown writing under a pseudonym.

renewed-contributions.title: Challenger
renewed-contributions.note: Author is Frederick Faust writing under a pseudonym.

author.authorized: Wylie, I. A. R. (Ida Alexa Ross), 1885-1959

renewed-contributions.title: The Sun Stood Still
renewed-contributions.note: Author is Frederick Faust writing under a pseudonym.

renewed-contributions.title: Charlie
renewed-contributions.note: Author is Frederick Faust writing under a pseudonym.

renewed-contributions.title: The Clock Strikes
renewed-contributions.note: FictionMags says this was credited to Leslie Ford, but the CCE renewal record only mentions Zenith Brown, the name behind that pseudonym.  We have not examined the issue in question.

renewed-contributions.title: Death Stops at a Tourist Camp
Come-On Girl
renewed-contributions.note: Author is Erle Stanley Gardner writing under a pseudonym.

renewed-contributions.title: Daughter of Divorce
renewed-contributions.note: CCE renewal record puts this story in this issue, but FictionMags places it in the December issue. We have not examined the issues in question.

renewed-contributions.title: Daughter of Divorce
renewed-contributions.note: CCE renewal record puts this story in the November issue, but FictionMags places it in this issue. We have not examined the issues in question.
